garden.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the area of land next to a house, where there are flowers, grass, and other plants, and often a place for people to sit
garden.translation[0].definitions[0].not: back/front garden (=at the back or front of the house)
garden.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Grace brought us some flowers from her garden.
garden.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a part of the area next to a house, which has plants and flowers in it
garden.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The house has a beautiful herb garden.
garden.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The garden is getting rather overgrown.
The hotel is set in a well-kept garden.
There was a small untidy garden behind the house.
Their house had a small front garden.
The children are playing in the back garden.
The cottage was surrounded by a flower garden.
The kitchen garden supplies vegetables to the manor house.
Rows of lettuces had been sown in the vegetable garden.
She helped me choose plants for the rock garden.
It hasn’t rained for a week – I should water the garden.
She was outside weeding the garden.
They planted a beautiful rose garden in her memory.
We keep the lawnmower in the garden shed.
Choose the right garden tool and you’ll do the job properly.
I bought the plants at the garden centre.
Garden furniture sells well when the weather is warm.
He accidentally left the garden hose running.
The garden pond was full of fish.
Somebody had stolen one of their garden gnomes.
Martin was waiting by the garden gate.
Elaine walked up the garden path and into the house.
The brown bin is for garden waste.
There was a trampoline at the bottom of the garden.
garden.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: areas and structures in a garden
lawn
an area of short grass in a garden
They were sitting on the front lawn of the house.
flowerbed
an area of ground where you grow flowers
The flowerbeds were well maintained.
rockery
an area of a garden where there are rocks with small flowers growing between them
hedge
a row of small bushes or trees growing close together, used for dividing one garden from another
a beech hedge
vegetable patch/plot
a part of a garden where you grow vegetables
patio
a flat stone area next to a house, where people sit outside
decking
a flat wooden area in a garden, where people can sit
pond
a small area of water in a garden
water feature
a small pool or structure with water running through it, used to make a garden look more attractive
greenhouse
a glass building where you can grow plants that need protection from the weather
shed
a small wooden building in a garden, where you can store things
work you do in a garden
cut the grass/mow the lawn
to cut grass using a machine
I need to mow the lawn.
trim a hedge
to make a hedge look neater by cutting small pieces off it
Hedges need to be trimmed regularly in summer.
cut back/prune shrubs
to cut pieces off a bush in order to make it grow better
March is the ideal time for pruning roses.
weed the flowerbeds/do some weeding
to remove unwanted plants
Dad was doing some weeding.
sow seeds
to put seeds in the ground
The children had been sowing sunflower seeds.
plant a plant/tree
to put a plant or tree in the ground so that it will grow
They’d planted a row of cherry trees.
deadhead plants
to remove the dead or dying flowers from a plant
When deadheading roses, make sure you use sharp pruning scissors.
garden.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to work in a garden, keeping it clean, growing plants etc
